Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: ruthpi
Reviews.Content: Great position only 5 mins walk to Bus and train stations and it has a lift!! Room was good size and clean. Breakfast reasonable - although not up to the standard of the cruise we had just been on! Nice lounge downstairs and quiet canalside setting. Good base to explore the whole of Venice island and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gardena”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie J
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had the opportunity to stay in Hotel Gardena in September 2011. What a charming place! The staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms were neat and clean. I would stay here again anytime! It was very near the bus station and easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star hotel... more like 1.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: ACandBC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3 star hotels the whole time we were in Italy and this place definitely did not measure up. It is a 1.5 star at best. The place is pretty outdated and just doesn't give you a welcomed feeling. The room appeared fairly clean but the carpet looked pretty old. I know smell is an issue throughout Venice but at times the bathroom smelled so bad we could barely stand to use it. The breakfast was average. The location is convienent to the train/bus station and it's walking distance to the main attractions. I would recommend looking for a nicer hotel for equal cost because our stay here was not inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Italian style and service, close to station and in town”
Reviews.Author: joe_cool_joe82
Reviews.Content: We chose the Gardena due to it's proximity to the bus station. Unlike many hotels in Venice, it was easy to find and only 2 small bridges from bus station (1 large from train). We arrived by cruise ship and caught the vappreto to the hotel; you can buy tickets for 6euros onboard the boats. We had a room overlooking the canal for one night. It was large and with good windows and wasn't loud (though it was Sunday). The tv was tiny and only had local channels. The bath and shower were ok. The receptionist was ok,but to the point and the breakfast was simple but satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Bit Late but better late than never”
Reviews.Author: LinandCol
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Gardena in February of this year. It was a very pleasant, bit jaded but the rooms were very clean and the linen was changed daily. It was in a brilliant position if arriving by bus or vaporetto from either airport and in a great location for getting about. As it's not as close to St Marks it's very reasonably priced and the local restaurants and bars were great - good food and not a 'rip off!' Ivan the evening concierge was very helpful and friendly and recommended some good places to eat. We had an amazing time in Venice and cannot wait to get back there. I would opt to stay in this part of the city as it's far enough away from the 'madding crowds' but everything was wonderfully accessable!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Kazi87
Reviews.Content: There wasn't anything wrong with this hotel, but nothing amazing! I travelled here with my best friend in August, and had requested a twin room when booking (through jet2 holidays). We arrived at about 12 (when we were supposed to be able to check in) and were told we had a queen room, so asked for a twin - was told to come back in 2 hours (not sure why as hotel was never full). We left our luggage and went off to explore a little. Found a lovely little cafe just a few minutes walk away 'La Bauta' snack bar, the guy working there is soooo friendly! We got back to the hotel at 2, and was given the key. No help with luggage which was dissapointing as 2 young women? The room was fine. A little smaller than the images looked but clean and everything in order. A fridge in the room was wonderful as we moved some stuff out of the minibar and put our water there. The air conditioning was very welcome as it was over 30 degree outside! Our room looked into the hotels courtyard, but also into somebodys flat - not a massive issue. It was very quiet. No noise whatsoever at night, and couldn't hear into anybody elses room as one reviewer said. The bathroom was also clean, very small but it was Venice. The shower was powerful, but no hot water during the day? (we wanted to shower when we first arrived). Towels were changed and room made up everyday to a high standard. Was expecting amazingly friendly staff from previous reviews - the gentleman during the day was not friendly. My friend thought he was rude, I wouldn't go so far (I'm quite laid back and bubbly!) but defo not friendly. However the chap thats on in the evening was great, chatty and happy to help; he should work the day! The hotel were not pushy. Some hotels have deals with cafes, or trips etc they never try to sell us anything. Breakfast was basic, I don't 'do' breakfast but would go and get a class of orange juice. My friend seemed quite happy with bread rolls and ham etc. I would have liked the TV to have had one sky chanel - like an international news station or something!? I liked the location, much quieter, but across the canal from the vaperetto stop and piazza roma for airport transfers. I would stay here again, but my friend wouldn't. It was fine, but not an overwhelming experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient for Public Transport”
Reviews.Author: BlackPear
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the night before our cruise from Venice, based on location, price and TripAdvisor reviews. Airport buses from both Marco Polo and Treviso airports arrive at Piazale Roma, a large square used as a bus station, with vast multi-storey carparking and the waterbuses adjoining. The main train station is also very near. The Gardena Hotel is a short walk from here - and this is welcome when pulling luggage! Venice is expensive, but the further you are from St Mark's Square, the cheaper it gets and public transport is efficient and a good way to see the Grand Canal on the way to St Marks. There are lots of places to eat in this area. Our room was larger than many in Venice and clean and comfortable. We enjoyed a quiet night's sleep and breakfast in the morning was typical Italian buffet style - not exciting but perfectly adequate. Only one member of staff seemed to be working in the restaurant so there was a delay in geting our coffee. The hotel was happy for us to leave our luggage for a couple of hours after we checked out. When we returned from our cruise a week later, we used the Left Luggage office next to the People Carrier terminal in Piazale Roma, which worked well. .

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgic”
Reviews.Author: dhfb59
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location away from crowds and near train and bus stations. Original rooms of good size and quiet and comfortable with decent view. For the price it was excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tinytines
Reviews.Content: We were after a hotel near the station, but still wanted that "venice feel" This was an absolutely perfect choice, on a canal, with lovely restaurants a short walk away, and you are not lugging you luggage on boats etc to get to the centre of Venice where ever thing is over priced. You can get a boat into centre in 15 mins or so, and the boat ride is through the canals, so perfect. The room was basic but clean (which is very important to me) and had nice decor, and a lovely "european breakfast" (think dried toast, ham and cheese etc) but i honestly prefer this to a full on hot buffet! I recommend this hotel highly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: burritoman
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in an ideal position if you are coming in via road or rail from Treviso, it is easy to find and saves lugging cases etc for too long,as you do see many people wheeling them all over the city. We stayed in room 34 which was roomy and had double windows with views of the canal below with small gardens beyond, we also had a side view of the grand canal . Ivan on the front desk in the evenings was a very friendly guy who gave us good tips for nearby restaurant's which were good quality with prices not too steep.He also seems very knowledgeable about most things Venice. Room was clean if basic, but had good shower and bathroom with a very firm bed and very clean sheets, all the essentials one needs when travelling. Breakfasts were a little limited with no hot food but it was all was very fresh, and waiting staff were friendly. Hotel was usually quiet ay night but was some boat engine noise in the early mornings as small commercial barges and boats used the canal below. We came at the end of festival time and the last day was very crowded everywhere but all good natured, after the festival ended it became much less crowded and easier to move about especially near St marks square. Restaurant's can be very pricey and it is best to avoid being upgraded by waiting staff with you menu choice as this usually is a very expensive option, we saw various couples throughout our stay that were very unhappy with their bill ,an example being two American/Canadian ladies who were charged 30 euros each for the special sea bass option running that night, so what with cover charges and service charges all added, not to mention separate prices for potatoes etc that came with the fish, and an expensive wine, must have paid in excess of 100euro, and this being a fairly ordinary Trattoria. All things considered about the Gardena is that it is a very good 3 star Hotel that makes a good base to explore Venice and its surrounding areas and we would certainly recommend it if you are looking for a good clean basic Hotel in a good location and not too expensive, in fact, for what we paid(travel agent rates) was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: BUCEPHALES
Reviews.Content: Stayed Monday to Friday during Carnival.Beginning of March 2011. Very cold windy weather which was not usual for Venice in early spring and it somewhat dampened the Carnival atmosphere. Our hearts went out to the marvellous people attired in their magnificent costumes and masks all day long everywhere in Venice including the islands of Murano and Burano. However our hotel always greeted with warmth and comfort. Many thanks to Ivan for all his invaluable help in his restaurant recommendations in the locale of the hotel. All were of the highest standard without breaking the bank. I shan't list them here-ask him yourself! A delightful man to talk to and chat with-your satisfaction is his priority.The hotel is very close to the bus and railway stations. Not very far to drag one's luggage over the bridges. The room that we had (32) was top notch for comfort,cleanliness and well appointed. The view out of the window was directly onto the canal outside and overlooked a garden park area . To the right you can watch the busy NW end of the Grand Canal.There was no welcome tray but there was a well stocked fridge at (as expected) very high prices. A little disappointed that the hotel bar was not well stocked; as we do enjoy a little tipple at the end of a long day getting lost in Venice ,but then again we were rather early in the season in spite of it being Carnival. Breakfast was ample,but no cooked food,i.e.bacon,sausages or toast. No problem though the food on offer was excellent. All the staff were very friendly and the service very good. We would heartily recommend the Gardena to any one looking for a well placed,comfortable,clean,and excellent value for money. ( We booked through Hotels4u-a branch of Thos Cook. We have found this site to be very competitive price-wise compared to all the others by several hundred pounds) So with the Gardena as your base indulge yourself in the fascinating city of Venice. Get lost and enjoy it's calles,campos,piazzas,awesome churches,islands and museums.Enjoy the food prepared in the Venetian manner in the trattorias etc. especially the fish. Invest in a vaporetto pass,buy it on the net before you go,otherwise it will cost you 6.50 euros every trip. You will need at least 4 days in Venice to appreciate just a little of it's dreamlike magic. Wander the streets early morning and late at night for even more mysterious atmosphere. Explore the outer regions to get a tourist free feeling for this historic place. We've been twice and there is still more to enjoy. Wish we had stayed at the Gardena last time!

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Pogo15
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in Hotel Gardena, Venice - a very well situated hotel with canal views. This small hotel near the railway station is scrupulously clean and we had a good sized room; the bedroom furniture is a little dated but absolutely inoffensive. The room has lovely winter sun all afternoon. The bathroom is big with a lovely full claw foot bath and good quality linen. Breakfast was an excellent continental style spread, generous and far better than others I have experienced with a great help-yourself espresso coffee machine. Staff at breakfast and on the reception desk very nice, informal and friendly. This was not what I expected from a hotel in Venice, far exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: RuthFinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gardena Hotel for two nights 19th & 20th December. Excellent little hotel with a good location. Easy to find when arriving by public transport. The main transport links are very close. The breakfast was excellent, very fresh and a good choice. The room we stayed in was large and clean. We really enjoyed our stay and found the hotel staff to be very helpful and friendly. We stayed for two nights for â‚¬100 including breakfast so the value for money was excellent. Venice itself is a beautiful place but a few warnings that you might find useful. We seemed to pay a lot of money every time we stopped at a cafe for a drink. â‚¬12 for a cafe and small beer. We went to a restaurant to eat and our â‚¬10 pizza and small starter came to nearly â‚¬40 !! We also decided to use our day pass to get the water taxi back to the airport. We did check this was okay when we purchased them but once we were half way we were told we have the wrong tickets, pricey mistake. The journey cost us nearly â‚¬30 !!! I would definitely return to Venice and I would definitely stay in the same hotel. But I would return with the knowledge that if you get a bottle of coke to take away I would pay â‚¬2.50 if you sit at a table it will cost you â‚¬5 !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- great value and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: champkis
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sister stayed in this hotel in the middle of august. It is in a great location right beside the grand canal and santa lucia station. It was very easy to get to coming from marco polo airport- we took the bus (it costs about â‚¬3) and it drops you to the station which is a 3ish minute walk to the hotel ! There are loads of restaraunts etc near to the hotel and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good- just a normal continental style breakfast.. cereal, tea/coffee etc, juice, bread, croissants, fruit, yoghurts etc. The rooms are clean and well kept. Overall, we were very happy with this hotel and I would definitely recommend it- such great value for a very handy location and nice clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms near the Santa Lucia station”
Reviews.Author: oink2u
Reviews.Content: Just watch out for the mosquitoes! The housekeeper kept the window in the bathroom open (thanks...) and there were a couple of mosquitoes hanging out in our room (make sure you watch the ceiling, where they know they're noticed less). But really, in a town that's surrounded by water, it wasn't a big deal. Otherwise, this hotel was a stone's throw from the train station, although it was on the other side of the Grand Canal. So you have to climb the bridge with all your luggage to get to the hotel. Vaporetto stop was near the hotel (on the opposite side of the Grand Canal - same side as the train station), and there's supposed to be traghetto service near there as well, but it apparently was not in operation while we were there. The rooms were clean with comfortable beds. Bathroom was spacious, and breakfast was good with coffee, ham, egg, jam, toast, croissants, cereal, milk, OJ - the basics. Thanks for making our vacation a great one! (Oh, and great hallway art!)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: vivaldi43
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's stay at this hotel and were extremely impressed with it. It is very conveniently located, next to a canal and very close to the Grand Canal and also near to the bus and train stations and also to the Vaporetto stops. There are restaurants and shops close by and many churches and other sites within a short walking distance. From the moment we arrived, the staff were very helpful and courteous. They gave us good advice concerning local eating places and also about how to get to specific sights. The room we stayed in was of very good size and overlooked a canal. It was beautifully decorated, very clean and quiet. It was great every night to return to it to relax after a day sightseeing in Venice.. The breakfast was also excellent, with a good selection of food and helpful, attentive staff. We loved our stay at the Gardena and would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaceyGreenTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located closest to the Venice car park with a simple vaporetta ride.Especially if you have luggage to cart around. It was clean and provided an excellent breakfast included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL IF YOU WANT TO BE INSULTED BY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Fefafefa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not what the photos show to be. It is old. Breakfast is so so. The only good thing was the coffee. WATCH OUT FOR THE STAFF THEY TREAT CUSTOMERS LIKE DIRT. The only good point of this place is the location. I SERIOUSLY RECOMEND YOU EVOID THIS PLACE. When I booked this hotel on 14th January for my 2 days stay in March the 20th I thought I made a good choice. The hotel looked really good in photos and location was perfect and the reviews were quite good. It was also the only hotel we could find at the time that had two rooms available (also for our friends). When we arrived to this hotel we were told that it was overbooked and have to go to another and as result separated from our friends. I was not very happy about that as I booked before everyone else and even my friends got a room. The receptionist didnâ€™t even try to explain nicely that the hotel was overbooked. He just burst with rage and said â€œthe hotel is over booked you have to go to another hotel, move, goâ€� we said no it can be and then he started screaming and saying you go there or stay in the street .......started insulting us swearing, heating the desk etc. It was like a movie. I can tell this is no one off burst up I got the feeling that this sort of behaviours is common in that place. I could tell by the way he told to us when I gave him the reservation details and by the way he was taking to the other people. The people that were behind me were scare to ask for their room. He was also impatient and short to them when they ask for their room.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot complain ..value for money .”
Reviews.Author: 643amc
Reviews.Content: Location ....5 minutes and two small bridges away from Piazzale Roma bus station , Train station and Vaporetto stop. Also 9 minutes walk or less from the supermarket at the end of the pier past the Vaporetto stops . Breakfast ... typically european , cereals , fruits , bread , ham , boiled eggs , croissants and cake , coffee , tea , fruit juices and very helpful staff service in the kitchen . Room .... nice clean and spacious by Italy city standards . 3 star bathroom , not small but adequate , good hot shower and very clean towels changed every day . Reception staff ... All are helpful ,but one particular staff gives the impression that he is doing you a favour if he answers your silly questions . Maybe I am paranoid ? Was given good advice when I bothered to ask and allowed to leave my bags in the hotel baggage storeroom for free for my late night departure after a last day in Venice . Hotel in General .....well kept and possibly recently refurbished or well maintained .Good lift and reception area , plus great location even if a bit? far away from Piazza San Marco . The room price is cheaper due to this fact ..probably .Canal view rooms are larger than back garden view rooms ..probably worth the extra Euros if I visit another time . One small complaint for the managent to fix .....the bathroom does not have adequate ventilation ..IMHO ! Would gladly stay in this hotel again .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gardena is one of Venice's lovliest”
Reviews.Author: FrancisO4
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of the car garage abd the train station it is situated on a quiet canal where gondolas pass regularly with gondoliers singing "Santa Lucia" for the saint and the train station. Wonderful breakfast. Rooms with windows opening on the canal. Very close to the site of the Pensione in the film "Pane e Tulipani". Great choice.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: monkeygirlLondon
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed at this hotel after a cruise departing from the port of Venice. The location couldn't have been better for a pre or post-cruise stay. The property is located on a smaller canal just off of the Grand Canal. Our request for canal view was honoured, which made it an exceptional value, considering most hotels charge twice the tariff paid for canal view. The staff were so professional and recommended a lovely restaurant nearby that was nothing like the tourist traps we saw across the Grand Canal. It was clear that the gentlemen running the property had a lot of pride in their city and hotel. Our room was recently renovated, light, airy and spotlessly clean. A simple breakfast was served in a little room near reception. This hotel was a great find and I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: LHYNDMAN
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable, clean, and nice/helpful staff. The room has a very luxurious feeling to it. It's right off of the Grand Canal. It's the perfect place to stay with a great price! They even recommended a wonderful restaurant nearby that we probably would have never found on our own. It had great service, price, and food! It's hard to get all three nowadays and they surpassed our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “atmospheric”
Reviews.Author: MMackDevon
Reviews.Content: my husband took me here for a special birthday. The hotel is excellently located a few minutes walk from the bus terminal & on a small canal with views of the grand canal. The hotel staff were very friendly. Breakfast was OK. I think for the price that was paid it was a little expensive. The decor in the rooms is not reflected in the photos on the websites and was a bit poor in places. The room was tiny. One thing to look out for, we were told on check out that we had to pay a bill for using the mini bar in the room however our room did not even have a mini bar (if it did we never found it), the person at the check in desk was quite argumentative when we questioned this. We have been back to Venice since and have found cheaper & more comfortable accomodation in the same area. From other hotles I have seen on line though I think the price & quality of this one are probably considered to be 'typically Venetian'.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel in October and found it to be pleasant but not good value at 170 Euros a night. It was a good location for catching the bus to the airport and it was quiet but I think I expected more for my money. The hotel is starting to look a little worn but that and the price would be my only complaint. The staff were extremely professional and our room was large and everything was spotlessly clean. I understand Venice is very expensive but compared to the other place we stayed this just did not seem good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sootsylv
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at this delightful hotel. It is situated in a position which is very convenient to the Bus and Railway stations. It was just round the corner from the Grand Canal and is very conveniently placed for exploring the delightful city of Venice. We had an excellent room, well and comfortably furnished, with a good window view. The en-suite facilities were first class and very clean. The room was quiet and we slept well. Breakfast was an excellent buffet meal which we very much enjoyed. Members of staff were always courteous and helpful, speaking excellent English. We are very much looking forward to visiting Venice again and will have no hesitation in staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great location for train station/bus terminal”
Reviews.Author: RichardReading
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Gardena. As mentioned by other reviewers, it is superbly located just over the bridge from the railway station, and a short walk (4 minutes) and 2 bridges from Piazza Roma, where the taxis and buses arrive. This is very important - we spent the weekend seeing tired tourists haul suitcases around the narrow streets and over canal bridges to get to their hotels! We got the bus from Marco Polo airport, which is superb - every 20 minutes and only 2.50 Euro's one way. We bought the 3 day publc transport pass at the airport, which includes that bus journey plus all water buses around Venice - which is great value and makes getting around Venice and the other islands fun. The hotel itself is small and on a quiet side cancal, just off the Grand Canal. We had a small room at the back - two twin beds pushed together, which wasn't ideal. If possible, ask for the rooms as the front - half are bigger but at least you have a canal view if you end up with a smaller room! We booked it through "X cape with us" (UK website) and paid Â£120/night bed and breakfast, which for Venice, is good value. Breakfast was nice, staff very pleasant. Hotel was also very clean, with good carpets and well maintained. We would definitely go back to Venice and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel close to train station”
Reviews.Author: flip21
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by chance. We were traveling by train and arrived in Venice without a hotel booked, yes this was the part of the trip we did spontaneously. We were very lucky. The porter spoke English, booked us a room at a reasonable rate, and we were pleasantly surprised to fin\d the room very spacious and bathroom clean. Also, the porter gave us a map and offered suggestions, which we took him up on, specifically the Gondola ride, The tickets through the hotel were cheaper than doing it on our own, And he also outlined a walkway for us to walk thru Venice, which we did and this helped with learning how to navigate thru Venice. After you leave the train station you have to go up a large bridge but it was worth it to go further into the city to the hotel. Here are some pictures I thought I would share.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSheTraveler
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom were adequate. Actually, the bathroom was better than most european rooms have. The place is not luxury, but its above average. We had windows that opened onto the canal below which really added to the ambiance. Breakfast was included, "european" with a few tasty highlights (fresh baked goods). The location is great if you arrive by train because you don't have to drag your luggage very far on boats and through winding alleys. Just over a bridge, a little ways down, and you're there! It is also really easy to find, which is not always true of hotels (or anything) in venice. The city is so small and the water buses are so cheap that this location is great for exploring. The "bus stop" isn't a far walk and if you go the opposite direction (left out of the hotel door) you can explore back streets and find some great cathedrals. While we were there, the owner helped us out by giving us a map and circling cathedrals with beautiful art (itâ€™s free!). Personally, I truly enjoyed the daily water bus ride down the grande canal. In about 20 minutes you can be at St. Peter's. But it's like a cheap river tour every day! We even stayed on the boat and rode all the way over to Lido and back just because. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: TommyGaughan
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty standard three star hotel in Venice, but it is very handily located opposite the main rail station (5 minutes walk) and in a quiet location. Breakfast was adequate and the rooms clean, best feature was the pleasant and helpful multilingual staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Start for Venice Tour”
Reviews.Author: keithz123
Reviews.Content: In a few words, we could have not asked for a better hotel. Rooms: Spacious bedroom, smallish bathroom, both very clean, with all traditional amenities. Breakfast: Good selection of croissants, toasted bread, fruit, yoghurts.. Hotel Staff: Little contact with them, but always helpful and cordial for checking-in and out, and when asked for help. Distance: Some reviews have included distance as a negative point. Despite not being exactly in the St.Mark's area, it's very easy to start discovering Venice from this hotel. First of all, an ACTV boat-stop is just 5minutes walk away (therefore 15mins to St.Mark by boat). By walk, it's not more than half an hour. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, relaxing Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Traveler's often envision their travel and are sometimes disappointed. We arrived in this city of beauty in the rain by taxi, having missed our water transfer but wouldn't let this dampen our initial view. The Hotel and the city were so very relaxing, we could have spent our entire week there. Without worry of dodging autos and motor vehicles, and soaking in the sheer beauty of the water city, the relaxation was well worth the plane ride there. We had expected dirty canals and odors as many told us but found the opposite. People were friendly, helpful, the city overflowed with atmosphere and beauty. Our concierge, Lucia answered our every need. Our hotel was on the canal where each morning we could enjoy seeing supplies being brought up and down the canals readying for another day in Venice. Food was pretty much the same, Pizza and paninis; wines were terrific, Island Murano is worth the taxi ride which is free through most of the Hotels if you ask. Travelers benefit when they find a nice outdoor cafe, listen to the Venetians and be one with the city and soak in everyday events that may not occur where you live. An example: the building of a new dock was something we enjoyed watching. We found the 30 minute gondola rides to be overpriced, overcrowded in the canalways and not worth the Euros, so we walked, walked, enjoyed and are ready to book another flight to Venice for a longer period of time. A few pointers: Get the three-day water taxi ticket; talk to your concierge about rides to Murano, gondola deals, exceptional places to see. They are an abundance of information. A person can walk the entire city in a few hours and see the total Venice from churches to Acadamia.

Reviews.Title: “Grand little place”
Reviews.Author: Joe723
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this choice. . It is in a great location. From the airport catch the No 5 bus and the hotel is then a 10 minute (max) walk from there. Simple then to get back to the airport again on the No. 5. This hotel is nicely aloof from the madness of St Marks square, but none of the charm of Venice is lost. The taxi boat is only minutes away with easy access to anywhere. Breakfast was simple but nice. Staff friendly. Bathroom a little small but all in all no complaints on the room. Room doors a little unconvincing, rooms not made for storing valuables for sure. No major frills but great value for money. . Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Gardena was fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: Jeki
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. It completely exceeded our expectations. First, it is very close to the train station - just walk over the bridge, and it is about a 3-5 minute walk to the right of the bridge. Being close to the station meant we were close as well to the main waterbus terminal, Ferrovia, which we took to get to the main attractions further down the Grand Canal. Second, the room was gorgeous and the staff were extremely helpful. We stayed in room 32 and we did NOT want to leave! The bathroom was all marble (floors and walls), with an old-fashioned sink and tub with beautiful detailing and design. The toilet had a wooden seat so it wasn't freezing cold when we sat down on it (small, but important detail!) The bed was queen size with a velvet headboard. The air conditioning was self-adjustable. In terms of view, I think we had the best view you could ask for - we were facing a smaller, more quiet canal but to the right we also had a spectacular view of the grand canal, with the water buses and taxis chugging by. The wardrobe was huge - enough room to fit both our things and more. Third, the area of the hotel is fantastic. It is away from the main touristy areas so a short walk gets you to some fantastic restaurants and shops. We loved Arca - it had homey, delicious Itatlian food and was also in a cute little shopping area. All in all, it was an experience to remember. A+ for Gardena!

Reviews.Title: “not too bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: aspalm
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Gardena to be convenient, although the accomodations themselves were average. As with all European hotel rooms in this price range, the room and bathroom were a bit small, but this was expected. Everything was extremely clean though, which is probably more important as you really don't spend much time in the room anyway. The hotel is just off the Grand Canal, about a 10 minute walk from the train station. It would not be even that long, if one could walk on water, but the bridge is quite nearby. Do realize that the rather large bridge traversing the Grand Canal here has steps on both sides, which is quite inconvenient for all the arriving tourists and their heavy luggage. So while you do save money and hassle by not needing a water taxi or vaporetto (bus), it still isn't an ideal situation, but oh well. The breakfast was comparable to other European continental breakfasts. Nothing too exciting. The staff were incredibly kind, though, and more than willing to help with all my obnoxious requests. They were also able to help book a reasonably-priced gondola ride as well. I would certainly be willing to stay here again, but the most glaring negative is that it is definitely a long way from San Marco's Square, where most of the sites and action are.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Gardena”
Reviews.Author: bdublu
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Nice location on a canal just off the grand canal near the train station. Convenient for vaparetto service. Friendly and helpful staff. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JohnHinds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gardena on a stop-over before going skiing. It was perfect for us as we didn't have much time, since it was so close to the bus station. The room was bigger than average and everything was clean. OK, it's not a luxury hotel but its very decent for the money and right by the grand canal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went in Venice for the New Year's eve (2005) and stayed at the hotel for a week. We found information about Gardena through the internet, and booked through there. The hotel was wonderful, just in the heart of Venice, near the train station, the bus station and near the canal (where we could take all the water buses for San Marco, etc). From the moment we steped in, until we left, the staff was really friendly and helpful, which made us feel like home. The most important was also that it was affordable, which allowed us to spend some of our savings in travelling around venice and the islands. The hotel is really wonderful, quiet, clean, with a touch of luxury but homy, small and sweet, which made our stay warm and cozy. The breakfast was really great and had everything someone would need to start the day, covering a variety of tastes. If we ever go back to Venice we will definately go there again. It is definately a very good choice, especially for people that don't look for really expensive big hotels, and want something that will be like a home for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: Based on Tripadvisor comments, I spent two nights. Most comments are very helpful and accurate. Close to train station; over the bridge and 4 blocks to the right. (Note: Orbitz map wrong). Small quaint hotel. Room size reasonable for Europe; clean and quiet except for occasional church bells. No English speaking TV. High bath room window would not close completely; but not a problem for me. Breakfast very nice; good selection of cold cuts, cheese, rolls, breads, cereals, and fresh fruit. GREAT VALUE. Would definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Gardena Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Santa Croce 239, 30135 Venice, Italy
